Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2007 12:53PM blackjack wrote: Hi everyone, Tom's of Maine works well as it is all natural. I was told not to use any deodorant that contained aluminum. You can also use cornstarch and talc. You can buy Tom's at Walgreen's or Jewel food store. I hope this helps. It worked for me. Happy Holidays to you, Blackjack
Posts.Title: Deordorant during rads ilenee Binney4

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2007 05:44AM blackjack wrote: Joni702., welcome to the board, I hope you are feeling better post surgery. I also had a lumpectomy in May and I started radation 6 weeks after surgery. I think it depends on if you need chemo which I did not need. I interviewed 2 rad onc before I decided which one to go to. I waited the 6 weeks because I personally could not deal with the thought of radation to my chest. I have lung issues and radation only made it worse for me. If you read more post there are women who have minimal side effect from radation and do very well. I think everone is different. I don't know of any places in NJ, but I would recommend going to a large univerity hospital who has the most up to date xray machine. You may want to ask about mamaosite if you are a canadate which is given x2 day for 5days. Hope all goes well and get us posted on your progress. Blackjack
Posts.Title: When do you start radiation? JoniB JukieF

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2007 06:23PM blackjack wrote: Joni0702, I wanted to let you know that if you are a canidate for mamosite it needs to be done within 2-4 wks due to the healing process. You can look up info on the mamosite web site. Ask lots of questions and you also can down load questions from the Susan B Koman web site under radation. Hope this helps. Keep me posted and I hope you are feeling better real soon. I know it is a long journey but we are all here for each other.  Blackjack
Posts.Title: When do you start radiation? JoniB JukieF

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2007 05:45PM blackjack wrote: Joni0702, Your surgeon can recommend an med onc for you that he deals with. Make sure your doctor explains your path report to you. This will usually tell you what type of tx you will need. Bring all your questions with you to your visit. You will have many team doc's, surgeon, med onc, onc radologist, family md just to name a few. If you have any question pm me. Hang in there. Thinking of you. Blackjack

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2011 05:50AM blackjack wrote: Hi girls, just wanted to add my own experience to this discussion. I was just in the hospital last week. As I sat in the ER with breathing issues and chest pain the nurse wanted to take my BP on my left arm for comparison. I had a lumpectomy and SNB on that side. I said NO and she told me my onc said it would be ok. My poor right arm is so bruised from BP's, blood draws and IV's that sometimes I think that it maybe ok to take a random BP. What are your thoughts about blood draws on the affected side? I do wear a sleeve at times. Just your thoughts..... BJ
Posts.Title: What are negative effects of taking BP on lymphedema arm? MrJoseph serenitywisdom

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2008 07:30PM blackjack wrote: Thanks for starting this post as I totally disagree with the rads mds. We can develop reactions to rads that are given to us.  I developed every side effect there was from rads since day one. The first tx I had I developed burning in my left breast as if someone put a hot poke inside of me.... then 3 days later I developed an asthma  problem. Then to top it off I developed a rash all over the upper part of my chest and neck area. They told me that I was in the sun to much..no I was house bound most of the time because I was soooo tired and fatigued. I had to go on steroids and pain meds for the rash and burnt breast. Oh and yes I now have lung damage from rads. So, please if you have symptoms let them know asap and keep telling them until you feel satisfy with your tx plan. Everyone experience's rads differently and my case was the extreme. Just wanted to share this as the SOB and chest pain you are feeling is real. As Shirlann says: the breast cancer, the gift that keeps on giving. Have a great evening Remember be healthy..be happy Blackjack

Developed multi nodules on thyroid in 5/ 09. I have been hyperthyroid ever since. I can't take the iodine as I have an allergy to IVP Dye. I did test positive for Barrett's in 08 then negative 6 months later. Has anyone ever had low white count because of thyroid problems? I am sooo frustrated with these mds. Just looking for answers...... Blackjack

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2007 08:17AM blackjack wrote: Amysharp, I just finished radation tx which I recieved double the dose, 21 tx and 4 boost. I had a an allergic reaction to the rads toward the end. My skin did not tolerated it very well, my left breast was burned, swollen and blistered open. I used lots of cream 3 x day and finally went to doing dombrax soaks to help with the burning. My experience with radation was not that good and the staff was not clued in to my emotional status. I hope your experience is better than mine and the staff is kind toward needs. Let me know how it goes. Blackjack

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2008 08:32PM blackjack wrote: Hi Joni, I wore sport bras during my radiation txs. I bought them at a sports store. Champion is the  brand. They have no wire,soft bra cup and are very comfortable. Some have front zipper to get in and out fast!! Also, bra Cammie are very comfortable to wear. They don't have a lot of support but at night they give a little lift. Take care, Blackjack
Posts.Title: No wire bras JoniB Binney4

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2007 01:06AM blackjack wrote: Hi everyone, I would like to comment on the lymphedema issue. I am post or 6 months and had 6 lymp nodes removes all ca free. I started simple wt lighting and massage therapy and this really helped me. My arm was numb due the fact they irritated the nerves during surgery. My trainer did massage x2 a week and I did arm streches and now I have full range of motion to my arm and minimal swelling. The more you use your arm the better. Hope this helps. blackjack
Posts.Title: NYT story on lymphadema/lifting weight PJB Dejaboo

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2008 03:02PM blackjack wrote: HI Joanne K, I had rads last summer and I did have wt loss. Mine was due to being sick from rads and having depression. I didn't feel like eating at all. I also had a very hard time with my rads txs as I went through the 3 week one which I had 21 tx and 4 boost. This bc can do havoc to our bodies so yes you can lose wt with some txs you are getting. I am 16 months post tx and I am doing fine. I exercise every day and have kept my wt off. I am not on meds per my choice so exercising is a must for me. I hope you are doing well. Blackjack

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2010 10:06PM blackjack wrote: Yummy... have you had your TSH, T3 ,T4 blood levels checked. I have my checked every 6 months as I am hyperthyroid. I too had a thyroid nodule biopsy and it was B9. I would ask to have the blood levels tested. There is always the wait and watch program which I am in right now. Sending you a healing hug your way. Blackjack
Posts.Title: thyroid cancer after breast? YUMMY ananda8

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2012 08:42AM blackjack wrote: HI Tamz, I too had a intraductal papilloma that was found on my yearly MRI. I had no symptoms at all. It was in my right breast noncancerous side. I had a core vacum needle biopsy done by MRI.  They took the whole thing out by a vacuum biopsy. They also put a marker in for further evals if needed. Most papilloms are b-9. If it is in large then it is a good idea to have it removed. Papilloms are usually found in the milk ducts and yes they can be a precursor to bc but most are b-9. You can find info about papillomas on bc.org. I will be thinking of you as you have your surgery. Think positive thoughts. Let me know what happens. Remember to be healthy...be happy. BJ
Posts.Title: Papilloma surgery next week... starting to worry Tamz knkmom

Posts.Content: May 5, 2011 05:59AM blackjack wrote: Hi , I am 4 years out and my lumpectomy scar is all but gone. I use Mederma cream and Vit E cream daily after my shower and my scar is very soft / faded. My bs told me to use the Vit E cream and it worked for me. Hope this works for you. Blackjack
Posts.Title: Scar Eliminator? ebombina timekpr

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2007 01:05PM blackjack wrote: Nevaeh, just wanted to let you know that I  developed tiredness after the first tx. My breast was so red and my chest hurt. I didn't make it the full 5 days. I developed a rash on my neck and chest only to find out that they were double dosing me with radation. My body could not handle the large dose give, so I missed a few tx to give my body a rest. Now my case may be different from others as I now developed skin reactions when ever I have to have xrays. My radologist was very insenative to my emotional status during this whole ordeal. I finally took atavian just to help me get through radation. I am 4 months out from tx and I am finally getting back to my old self. My breast is better, still swollen but I can deal with that. All I can say is be proactive with your doctor. If something doesn't feel right tell them right away and insist on an answer. I hope you have a better experiance then me. This breast cancer has been one hell of a journey for me. But in the end I hope to be ok. Take care. Blackjack
